author: nostalgia
title: the closure.
post_content: i really thought you were different. even at the end of our relationship, i still thought that you will never hurt me and that you still cared for me in ur own ways.that even as a normal friend/ex gf, you will still be kind enough to spare a though for my feelings.but the more i know, the more i heard and the more i uncovered, the more i feel disappointed and angry with myself. because i no longer know who i was with this past one year. was it all an act? or maybe the you right now is your true self and is who you really are.i chose to believe that you were that same person who loved me and the same great person whom i've chosen to be with. but i guess i was so wrong. you are just someone who can easily transfer your emotions to anyone within a week of the end of a one year r/s. i rem someone saying this to me before during one of our arguements, "...all i know is she really loves you alot". and yes, i used to believe that. even till the end of our r/s i believed so. until you just made a total mockery of whatever love you had for me or love that we shared by moving onto someone else all in less than a week. maybe you already have made a mockery of our r/s in the midst of the times when we are together, i will never know the truth, and i don't think i want the truth anymore. i should have known. that you were no different.thanks for making me feel damn stupid for refraining from doing certain things just because i still spared a thought for how you felt, and all i got was a big fat slap in the face that you actually can't really be bothered about how i felt afterall, even as a basic human being. that my consideration of how you would feel was totally replaced with your total disregard of mine. thanks for making me feel like our love was all a hoax. i guess bestie is right - "never trust the words of anyone, especially those who broke up with you."

author: Talthea
title: Nope, not a fan of money.  I'm a bad capitalist.
post_content: I'm sitting here, up at 1:38am (which is not unusual for me but tonight i've a sorry excuse as to why), doing things like creating crazy journal accounts randomly, and waiting for my damn paycheck to transfer automatically to my damn bank account so that i can transfer some damn money to quit being overdrawn (damnit). Unfortunately i've been LIED TO and it's still not there an hour and a half after it was supposed to be. Geez, Louise.I'm pretty tired. (Every time i say that i think of "Forrest Gump." It is good. And it means that movie is in the back of my mind at all times.) I think i should stop typing right now and just go to bed. I'm waking up in less than three hours so I know i should go.I've been working the graveyard shift at my work once a week lately. We unload the truck and since i work in a framing retail shop all of our merchandise is heavy, and we're always getting way too much of it. This here be the relevance: my hands are changing. They look strong now, an odd mixture with their relatively small size; my veins have become prominent. I can't stop looking at them as i type.Hands to me are a fascination. I shake other people's hands for kicks. (Though i'm usually repentant at the occasional disconcerted expression, i've yet to change my ways.) I believe that the most beautiful part of the human body is the crevice the thumb bone creates when flexed. (It's prettier done than said.) I stare at them in all of their gesticulating wonder when animated people talk and must remind myself to make eye contact. They, to me, are a distraction. But since i couldn't tell you just what from, i see no reason to remedy the situation. I think the whole thing is pretty swell anyway.I suppose i will fall down somewhere now, close my eyes and call it sleep.Faretheewell folk,-Talthea (5/13/04)

author: elbacude
title: Severe OCD and moderate dependency
post_content: Since I've decided  to try to post to my blog every now and again, I just set up the option to do so  by email. This is the first time I'm trying it so as I write I'm thinking about  whether this is going to end up on a Google server somewhere or disappear into  the ether.  &nbsp; Yesterday was  Australia Day and the long weekend brought with it a visit by some relatives of  ours from New South Wales. These people love sports and anyone who knows me  would immediately ask how it is that I could be related to them. In any case, I  am, and it happens that Marcos Baghdatis (the brother of a former classmate of  mine from Cyprus) is doing exceptionally well in the Australian Open. Not that  people have ever needed a reason to talk about sports but the rarity of a  Cypriot being in the final rounds of any major sporting event is of utmost  national importance and begs for conversation. &nbsp; I think the  conversation was somehow connected to both the tennis and the soccer when my  mum's cousin said "Sport brings people together and their differences don't  matter". I thought about this statement for quite some time. I remembered the  national flags the people waved around, the colours, the attitudes, the remarks  that sports commentators made about players and the audience, the fans chanting,  the confrontations, who was/wasn't considered a "real fan" and all the other  wonders that accompany the world of sports interest. Differences don't  matter? &nbsp; My father told me  that at the end of one of Marcos' earlier games&nbsp;the media interviewed his  father. The fans in the background were&nbsp;screaming nationalist&nbsp;chants  about the Turks getting out of Cyprus (in greek of course) and the commentator  asked his father "what are they saying?" to which he responded something along  the lines of "... that Marcos is the best and they believe he will definitely  win". This is actually quite a complicated situation to try to make sense of.  Nationalist sentiments are so intricately connected to various aspects of  identity and how this is uttered and (re-/per-/con-)ceived is a whole other  story. &nbsp; Why did they choose  to foreground their nationalist ideologies at this sports event? Who did they  believe was listening and hence who was this message for? To assume that  sports flattens difference is to lose sight of a whole number of games that are  going on between more than just the players of the sport itself; language games,  body games, group games, national games, global games, amongst others are just  another way in which power circulates to maintain the status quo. So sport might  bring certain people together but most of the time I would argue it makes  unequal divisions in our societies even more acute by drawing on how our  differences have been constructed. &nbsp; Now let's see if  sending this email actually posts this on my  blog!

author: Santosh Rao
title: Global Gyaan ----    Management in Action
post_content: Phew.........took ages for me to come up with the title for this posting, pretty darn appropriate it is too, you might as well admit not that no one is looking at you.......As always in times of utter despair, total boredom and a goose ball state of mind, I turn to blogger to pen in some more nonsense that i will try to decipher a couple of years down the line, perhaps.....You know it always seemed strange to see all my geeky friends regularly blogging and worse than that reading other people's blog and commenting on it....I could never explain their unbridled inquisitiveness and a coupled with a complete lack of better things to do!!! It always felt like you are talking to a computer or my mathematics teacher, neither of which you could get a straight answer out of. Now that I think of it make that any answer out of...After some failed (I call it failed as no one would read them even if I paid for it) attempts at blogging I could figure out one plain, bare fact. My English sucked !! The grammar and sentence formation was appaling. The usage had the finese and intelligence of a 4 year old kid from the wambusi tribe who had just seen how to make fire by banging(I hope you do realise that i use the word banging in a moment of intellectual starvation and sorely for the want of a better subtituition) two stones (Stones is just fine as any other word, dont think too much about it).Despite all this confusing thoughts I shall soldier on and complete this post for two main purposes ..Firstly I have always harbored this desire to be an author, again a pursuit which has witnessed many a heroic effort and equally tragic and immensely forgettable failures. My Cunning plan is as follows. Through blogging build up my diction sufficiently to be able to articulate the thoughts in my brain in a manner that would do justice to my magnificent and dare I say wonderfully gifted imagination. Phase 2: Author a children's novel that will unseat the mighty Noddy and having done that sky is truly the limit..... You acn book your copies now by calling the toll free number 1600-420-4200The second pupose , update on life or atleast the part of life fit to be shared publicly. Match rained out so that suddenly floods me with 8 more hours to do something. A luxury I could have well avoided. Dad's Bday today so will probably have a small celebration at home later..... You know i actually do more coller stuff but i dont want to make you people jealous, so i am leaving all that out.I think thats quite enough for the day a non standard disclaimer to finish "All incorrect usages are deliberate and used just to add humourousness". If you dont get some parts just laugh aloud and no one will know that you didnt understand.......Hmmmmm.... now that all this is over i am actually thinking of why i agve this title? Maybe something on it next time.....

author: dana
title: Lovely autumn weather!
post_content: Kyoto temple detail    Originally uploaded by danabree.      Kyoto old painting    Originally uploaded by danabree. It's been a while since I updated this site, so I apologize for that. Between going back to Canada for Christmas, starting 2 university courses part-time, and going out with friends it seems like every night, been really busy recently!!Christmas in Canada was great, the weather was about the same as it was in Nagoya. Great catching up with the family, although it took a while to realize that I could understand everything around me language-wise, and that everyone could understand me. Except for the guy at the Starbucks on Robson Street in Vancouver, not sure what was up with him!! Certainly gives me a newer perspective on living in Japan. Things that really used to irritate me (like really terrible tv commercials, what are the Gulliver people thinking?!!) seem not as bad now, after seeing endless dumb cleaning product ads on Canadian television!! There does still seem to be a lack of logic a lot of the time here though. For instance, recently the UFJ bank machines have an alternate language option, so you can do a deposit or withdrawal in English, Chinese, Korean, or Portuguese. Makes sense to me, as there is a decent amount of people who live here who speak those languages as a mother tongue. However, a friend pointed out that it is probably just a promotional thing happening while Expo is going on, and that when Expo disappears, so will the other languages. I don't understand why, as they've already done all the hard work doing the programming and stuff! It's not like there's a little guy sitting in the machine, translating away! Another thing that doesn't make sense is that bank machines in Japan close at night and on the weekends. You can't get any money out except during banking hours. I knew about that before I got my bank account, which is why I am with UFJ bank, they actually have 24/7 bank machines. However, they sometimes have them in little booths that are only accessible during banking hours, the rest of the time they are locked! Huh????? I am slowly learning that the worst question to ask about anything in Japan is "Why?". Either there isn't an answer, or it's something like "It's always been done this way, so that's the only way it can be done". I'm trying not to pay attention to stuff like that, or else I would go nutty! Well, I already am a little nutty, so maybe too late!!Went to Kyoto last week with some friends from work, it was great going back there. I haven't been back since I left to move to Nagoya, so it was nice seeing it again. I just love the temples, and I love the scenery and cute little shops in Gion. It was nice being able to actually appreciate the city. When I was living there last year, I was trying to be really careful with my money, as I didn't know when or if I would get a job. So, I didn't go into stores and such, as I knew I would just be too tempted to buy things. There are some really beautiful things in those little stores, some of them just look like someone's house, until you walk in and see stuff for sale! Through a friend, I discovered the joys of yattsuhashi - like a soft chewy pastry with filling inside. Yummy, especially the choco-banana variety!! The traditional ones are nice too, but choco-banana rocks!! Also, when I was living in Kyoto last year, I was very culture-shocked, which really affected how I saw the city. It was nice going back, now that I am basically acclimatized to Japan. It was a beautiful day, even though it was a little cold. The photo of the painting was at Kitanotenmangu shrine, and an old guy there said it was about 300 years old. Very cool!! The detail of one of the shrine buildings is from the same place.Teaching going ok, but right now we are deciding on which kids go up to the next level in April, which ones stay, etc etc. My boss is totally stressed!! Most of the kids are nice, but it seems like a lot of them don't get any discipline at home, which carries over into the classroom. They're smacking you and telling you to shut up, and the mothers are just sitting there going, "Isn't my child so cute!!". No honey, not cute. Either that, or they're terrified of their mum and are so quiet they kind of freak you out. Luckily, compared to some of the kids the other teachers have, most of mine are relatively well-behaved. I think I'll be able to teach for a few more years without losing my marbles, but that's why I'm doing some university courses from New Zealand, to give me some options later. Studying towards a BA in Politics, taking World History since 1900 and Politics at the moment. I hope one day to work for the Canadian or NZ government doing counter-terrorism work. Endlessly challenging and interesting!So, life in Japan is proving to still be interesting, if at times befuddling. But, as I just found out, I passed my level 3 (sankyuu) JLPT test, which is great, and at least gives me hope that one day I'll actually be able to communicate! My boyfriend keeps trying to get me to speak in Japanese, but my vocab is so low that it's really difficult. A friend suggested I start studying the kids cram school (juku) books, so that's what I'm doing now. Just started with the grade 1 book, and it's proving really useful for learning new vocab and practicing kanji. I now know the Japanese for lumberjack, sunflower, and woodpecker - I know, they will be terribly useful in everyday life! I certainly get some strange looks on the train, studying using a grade 1 kids book!! Good practice though, and then I can go up level by level, and actually start to read stuff like books and such. The only thing I can read at the moment is stuff designed for foreigners learning Japanese. Interesting, but not exactly the kind of stuff that I would find in daily life, or that will help me learn grammar and vocab easier. I love reading, and I figure if I can get to the point where I can read stories and such, then I can just start to absorb the grammar and vocab that way, like you do when you are learning your own language. So who knows when my next post will be, but I'll try to make it more than one or twice a season!!

author: Sridar D
title: 3D Designs Advance Light Chips
post_content: Among the most widely used hash functions today are the so-called MD5(for Message Digest #5). MD5 produces a hash that is 128 bits long andthat is commonly written as sequence of 32 hexadecimal (base 16) digits.If you were to take my name and process it with MD5, you would get thisseemingly random string:c55bbe0f3ba258f5b1cb6d5b62b0b360Or, to state it with more mathematical formality:MD5(?Simson Garfinkel?)= c55bbe0f3ba258f5b1cb6d5b62b0b360Each of those hexadecimal characters represents 4 bits; the MD5 value ofmy name is actually:11000101010110111011111000001111001110111010001001011000111101011011000111001011011011010101101101100010101100001011001101100000Most people work with the hexadecimal representation because it?s prettyeasy to look two hashes and tell if they are the same or different.MD5 works by splitting the file up into lots of small pieces, and thentaking each of those chunks and performing hundreds of mathematicaloperations that shuffle, invert, transpose, and otherwise process thebits into an unrecognizable mess. The word ?unrecognizable? in thisdescription is key. The fundamental requirement of a good hash functionis that it should be impossible to predict the fingerprint of a filewithout actually going to the effort of computing that fingerprint?there must be no short-cuts. If there were, you might be able to runthe hash function backwards and create a file that had a specifichash?for example, the hash of another file. Indeed, the entire securityof hash functions falls apart utterly if it is possible to generate twofiles that have the same hash.The beauty of the hash function is that even a tiny modification to theinput produces a dramatic change in the output. Mathematically, thefunctions are designed so that every bit in the output will have a 50percent chance of changing for every single bit changed in the input.Let?s look at another MD5 hash, this one of a slightly differentrepresentation of my name:MD5(?Simson L. Garfinkel?)= df876e8e6f548d5be698fab7f06dd278Merely adding "L." produces a completely different hash. If you comparethe two hashes bit-for-bit you?ll find that 63 out of the 128 positionshave changed from a 0-to-1 or a 1-to-0, and the other 65 have remainedunchanged.Unfortunately, the whole theory of cryptographic hash functions has ahuge problem. The use of these functions requires that there be noso-called "collisions". Either accidentally or on purpose, there shouldbe no two files that have the same cryptographic fingerprint. And as itturns out, this is an impossible requirement.The reason is pretty simple. File fingerprints are a fixed size, whichmeans that there is a finite number of possible fingerprints. Files, onthe other hand, can be any size. Thus, there are more possible filesthan fingerprints, and so there must be at least one fingerprint that isthe fingerprint of multiple files. The mathematical term for this is the?pigeonhole principle.? Indeed, even if you restrict yourself to filesthat are just nine characters long, there are still 256 times the numberof possible files as the number of possible fingerprints.The reason that the pigeonhole principle doesn?t render hash functionscompletely pointless is that there are an astounding number of possiblefingerprints?far more, in fact, than the number of files on the planet.(With MD5 there are 2128 possible fingerprints. Now, the total number ofcomputer hard drives that have ever been manufactured is only around229. If every hard drive had a million unique files?a grossoverestimation?there would still be only 249 individual files. That?s amuch, much, much smaller number than 2128.)  source: Technology Review

author: Brimmy
title: My Belated New Year's Post.
post_content: Current Mood: FREAKIN TIREDWell, here it is about a month after my last post and what do i have to say? Well in the span of about a month we had a fire in my apartment and we were forced to move out, i've put on a little weight having been neglecting the gym and not really being able to make any food of substance without a kitchen, i had an amazing valentines day with a good friend, and classes are already kicking my ass.The fire was caused by some kinda electrical problem, and it only destroyed a few items, but it filled our entire apartment with black soot which covered all our stuff. We were forced to throw out a lot of food, and had to wash nearly everything. It took us a week of being homeless and living with friends before we were able to find a new place, which in my mind is pretty damn fast. Now we're moved into a new house which is even bigger, has a fireplace, a den, a huge garage, and a back yard. Best of all, we're paying slightly less than at the last place. Anywho it's not too bad, and it provided the perfect ambiance for my date on valentines day.Well i probably should be doing some last minute studying for my class that i have in about 15 minutes so ill cut this post short, but hopefully ill be updating soon, and god willing more often.

author: Mike
title: A song of how I feel as of this moment
post_content: Well its 5am on sunday and i'm still awake...every night i try to sleep and every night thoughts of you work there way into my head. I try to blur them out but it seems the harder i try the more easier it comes.  wave after wave crashes down on me full of emotion and memories of you. i think back to the times we slept togther and spent the entire day togther laughing and talking. but its not the conversations that i miss... it;s the silence that we had togther. it makes no sense but whenever you and i could worship your beautiful face and never have you speak a word...its the times that i watched you sleep peacefully in front of me as i gently moved the hair from your face...but most of all its the fact that your soul is so beautiful and pure and that i wont see it every again...these thoughts that cause my heart to ache and feel as if there's nothing in the world that can stop it except of course you. i wish i could sleep but everytime i listen to the slient still room my mind wanders and all i have are my thoughts... its a frightening feeling when a person wishes they could erase their memory just to make life go a little easier for them... i know this first hand and hopefully you will never know this feeling...i guess by preventing you from ever reading this i can protect you from it and i guess that will be the greatest thing i can do for you...i miss you so much and i wish that i could drop everything in my life and hold you.

author: Hazza
title: Holiday Saga - Part 1
post_content: So I didn't finish the saga that afternoon...oh well.Anyway, Mum and I flew back from Queensland to Melbourne...and came home. I had a nice few days living at the Kilmore house, because at that point I was still based at Grandma's house. On the 8th of January, Lauren had her birthday thing, so all the TKIS kids still in the district went to that. It was fun, but I was a little on edge from some things that had happened in Qld, so I needed a bit of support. Oh, and Cedrik and I, while play-fighting, managed to put a huge hole in Lauren's wall, courtesy of Cedrik's arse.The next day, Cedrik and Jess and Simon and myself scabbed a lift from Lachie's dad to the end of Jeffrey's lane to wait for the Schneiders' mother. I was sure that there was no way that she would be there soon, so we walked to my Grandma's house and waited there. Grandma wasn't home, but I figured that she wouldn't mind...and she didn't either.We drove to Porepunkah an hour or two later, and ended up spending an interesting week there. Cedrik and I had a couple of issues that needed to be worked out, but weren't by the time the holiday was over. We did some interesting things; went to a waterslide, hedgemaze, out to dinner, shopping, swimming, homework (though that isn't interesting) and generally had a good but relaxed time. I've taken to describing it as "pleasantly uneventful." Anyway, Jess and I went home a week later, and very nearly missed the train...I felt very uncomfortable with Mrs. Schneider pushing 140kph along the highway.The rest of the holiday I spent hanging out, and yes, Cedrik and I did get our problems resolved so by the time I started school it was all good.

author: ZAblogger
title: 25 July 2004
post_content: And here we are on Monday the 2nd August 2004! Amazing isn’t it? What a weekend lies behind me, boy oh boy! The Friday night during the last gasps of my final shift of the week, I get a call from Stefan asking me whether I want to go out with him, Reyno and Enver (our Turkish friend).  We started drinking a hell of a lot of alcohol in Hatfield (with the intention of getting totally splattered) and ended up at a club called Recess in Burnette   street Hatfield. It is within walking distance from Drop Zone, which is the club where we started drinking. They had a buy one, get one free special.       In the cue at Recess I met a girl with some of the most intriguing tattoo’s on here lower back. We seemed to click but I did not have the guts to really get to know her until it was too late and another guy was chatting her up. The story is way more embarrassing than this and therefore I will not tell it. Reading this in future will however remind me to be more upfront with women.       Recovered most of Saturday until around 11h30 when the Springboks played Australia in Perth. We lost by the width of a pubic hair but that aside, it was fun to watch. We all met up at Her Gunter’s in Hatfield for the game. After the Springbok match we marched on over to Securicor Loftus for an in the flesh encounter of the Blue Bulls vs. The Vodacom Cheetahs. We won that game by the width of a pubic hair…       Saturday night ended up in a wine tasting expedition at Phil’s house. Lots of fun and we spent in the order of 6 hours at his place drinking good wine and talking tons of shite! FUN!       On Sunday I played America’s Army with 3 of my friends the whole afternoon till late at night.        GREAT!!!!

author: Akane
title: Sharbon Dama
post_content: I think I'm going to give up on looking at the 'recent visitors' page on our website.  I began looking at it so I could get an idea of what people are looking at.  You know - try to make more of the series people are looking for.  Unfortunately, I also keep seeing these assholes hotlinking my wallpapers as backgrounds for their blogs.  ><  I can't yell at them because the picture doesn't show up anyways thanks to the hotlink protector; it doesn't take up bandwidth either.  It just annoys me to no end seeing how lazy people are.  Just... just eat shit and die.  Please?  That's all I ask.Don't read this if you haven't seen past episode 100 of Inuyasha:I watched about 70 episodes of Inuyasha and I still want more!! ;_;  I went all the way up to episode 155.  After that there's only 15(?) left and probably a movie.  I hate Kikyou...  I thought she dissolved, but no - she still wanders about.  I sort of felt bad for here during her special, but that was for a second, literally.  You know for a miko she's pretty self-righteous.  Why would Inuyasha say those things to her... because he didn't - that is why.  I think the character that gets my sympathy the most in Kohaku.  At least he now remembers what he did and stayed sane.  This is progress.  Hakudoushi (older version of Naraku's baby) is really creepy.  Plus that whole Naraku... spawning a... baby - it is a little weird to me.  At least the baby part did not talk again after it was split in two.  Uck.        I really like Sesshoumaru; he's becoming a favorite and I'm not sure why.  Unfortunately I think the bad-ass factor comes into play a lot, but there's something else.  I really like how he and Rin interact.  He does talk to her much, but he's literally the family she never had.  I know he's going after Naraku because of his pride, but I think it's a little for Rin too.  Kouga has matured in the last twenty or so episodes as well.  I've gained more respect for Kouga lately.  I hope he continues this way.  I think Inuyasha has become so useless cause he's separated from the others and Naraku keeps calling time-outs.  Inuyasha and friends work best as a group, but now everyone has an individual to fight.  Plus, Naraku has called back the Shichinintai two or three times to make them stronger or put them in another location to give his side the upper hand.  Cheater.  Naraku is just a huge cheater.  I need to get Naraku a real TV with cable... instead of setting up the drama and watching unfold on the Kanna-TV.  Maybe he needs satellite instead of cable. Happy Valentine's Day to all!! <3Now it is time to catch up on my homework and then Naruto.  Hehehe - Naruto... I love it! Yeah, I should probably go to sleep now.  Yup.

author: Zan
title: Once Again
post_content: It's been awhile since I've updated my friends on what I've been doing, and what I've experienced. Another year has passed for me, for my birthdate has passed once again. Since my last attempt at writing and blogging, I've worked in oil fields onshore and offshore, I've explored the natural offerings of Borneo, I've been left by my girlfriend of six years, changed my career from engineer to pilot, and am now undergoing training to become an air passenger pilot for a leading carrier in the world. I write these down so that I'll remember that, these past couple of years has passed by full of memories, and experiences that teaches, made me grow, and know where I want to head to in this life of mine.

author: Diadem
title: （2007-4-3）炒股日记
post_content: 星期一的时候，银行的钱始终无法转入证券的帐号中，只好眼睁睁的看正鲁能泰山涨了几毛阿，无法买进。打电话到交易软件咨询：为什么资金转不过来，转帐的状态是2008；回答是：开户的证券所后台有问题；打电话到广发的营业厅回答是：农行的银证功能可能还没有开通，已经在催农行了。唉，农行的办事效率真低。今天星期二了，试着转帐100到证券帐号，成功了。但是这个核新交易软件有BUG，资金没有及时刷新，唉，同是做软件的，这么不专业，向我学习学习吧，只好退出重新进入，再次转帐8000，反先还不够，再转了10000，唉，没有经济头脑啊，这样转岂不是给银行又多赚了点。既然转帐成功了就迫不及待的买股票了，今天的鲁能泰山又涨了几毛了，我只要以5.70的价格下单，已经找到6.20了，比起星期一涨了快8毛，亏啊，算了，不买这只股了，这支可是我盯了好久的阿，可恶的农行。这个时候烦了所有新手都容易犯的毛病，一定要持仓，才觉得舒服，才觉得没有丢失机会，好吧，买了1000股海尔，这可是绩优股，靠，一买就跌，烦啊。慢慢等吧，今天就不用买了。

author: Kearneyweard
title: Questionnaire and TF2 Gamerchix Night
post_content: So it's been 10 days since Fable II came out and I am really enjoying it. Those of you who know me are aware of just how long I've been waiting for this game. I currently have 865/1000G. I only need 7 more achievements and they are:The CompletionistGet all expressions, pet tricks and abilities, or see another Hero do so - 50GI am currently working on thisThe HoarderCollect every silver key, or see another Hero do so - 25GI have to do a third playthrough to get this. So frustrating! There are two keys that if you don't get them in the beginning, you're screwed. LAME!The SharpshooterHit three enemies with one shot, or see another Hero do so - 10GThis is such a bullshit achievement. Gah!The DuellistString together a full-speed chain attack, or see another Hero do so - 10GBullshitThe ExecutionerSacrifice 10 ppl in Temple of Shadows, or see another Hero do so - 10GWorking on it, will have it soonThe TeaserMake bandits respond to expressions with fear, anger, mirth, and confusion... during combat - 5GWill have it soonThe GargoyleFind the gargoyles' legendary treasure - 25GI only have 15 more to find. There's a total of 50.If anyone wants to help me get these, you'd be my new hero. ;) LolMy husband likes to leave the television on Cartoon Network when he goes to bed so I have been watching Goosebumps while writing this post. Man that brings back some memories. I remember this show used to be scary, lol, now it's just lame. However, I don't see myself changing the channel; I think I like the trip down memory lane.I've been so consumed with Fable II that I completely forgot today is Halloween. The hubby has to work but I am scrambling trying to find a haunted house nearby so we can go when he gets off. Either that or have a scary movie marathon party like we did last year. Hey, it sounds lame but it was loads of fun.Have a good one guys and gals. Be safe and have fun!~Kearneyweard~

author: Piedmont Pete
title: Piedmont Pulse
post_content: Why is our country in the shape that it is today? Don't you find yourself asking that question more and more?We have come a long ways since our country was first founded. Religious freedom played a big part in the formation of this country. Somewhere along the way we seem to have lost track of our roots. And that is a real shame.Permissiveness, drugs, alcohol, sexual freedom and much more has led the the complete moral decay of a once great country. As we added so much to our historic legacy with the industrial revolution, the space age and greater things we have lost track of our heritage. What made us really great was our religious beliefs. Now we burn churches and worship idols. We could have become even greater and stronger but we chose the easy path. A path of destruction.Where will it lead us? Only God knows the answer to that. But I would recommend that when that time comes you should be ready. Repent and be saved. God forgives even the worst of sinners. He gave his life on the cross for our sins. He gave his life because he cared for us. Now it is our turn to come back to the cross and ask for forgiveness for our sins.

author: orlandobritney
title: Britney Spears: An Apology
post_content: Britney sold 252,381 copies of her greatest hit album in its first week and debut strong at #4 on Billboard Top 200, after facing fierce competition from Eminem, Shania Twain and Toby Keith. I'm very pleased with how the album is doing, and I'm positive that her greatest hit will be selling steadily. Of course, I would like her to debut at #1 if possible, but four consecutive #1 albums and five consecutive Top 5 album is an amazing feat. It's a record that will be very difficult to break.

author: Vhampire
title: Telecinco en San Isidro
post_content: La dejo para más adelante. El titulo es en homenaje al libro de Revel. En este blog iré añadiendo fragmentos de lo que oigo, veo y leo en los medios, fundamentalmente españoles. Digo fragmentos porque es imposible abarcar todos los ataque que reciben los Estados Unidos continuamente. Posiblemente se merezcan criticas pero el numero de ellas que no tienen sentido y están injustificadas es tan grande que las justificadas pasan desapercibidas. En su momento repasaré el pasado, como ejemplo de bajeza moral el titular del diario "El Pais" el 12 de septimebre de 2001, pero ya habrá tiempo de hablar de eso.

author: Matt
title: Movie: Garden State
post_content: Evolution is pushing the human species away from talking. I feel a strange and increasing lazyness when opening my mouth. Speach is slow an cumbersome. Our mouths and jaws will become less pronounced. In the future communication between humans will eventually happen as synaptic exchanges.I see evidence around me of people preferring texting an instant messaging over speach. The trend is set. What a glorious thought, as to paraphrase Michael Stipe I'm "loosing my humanity". Embrace it and rejoice.

author: Mandi
title: What a day
post_content: Well I know it's been ages, and to be honest i never expected to be writing on this again.So much has happened I don't even know where to start.  Guess it's best to put so much in the past and just focus on the future :)I'm very happy at the moment, never thought I would ever be this happy.  Things just seem to be falling into place. I think the secret is letting other things go.  Recently when a friend of mine explained how he is now with a married woman it kind of put so many things in perspective.  I was upset when he told me, not because what I thought he was doing was wrong, but the fact that he (for many years) portrayed himself to me as something that he is definetly not.  Why I'm saying all this is that, it made me move away from all of that and concentrate of the people who really care about me.  I now know that person never even cared about our friendship, so it's time to move on.I'm off to Queensland on Sunday with my special someone and i can't wait.  I intend to swim, eat, drink and be merry hehehe.  I only have a week of work but hey that is better then nothing.I felt so great finishing work today, I left my desk totally clean and all my work done.  It felt like such a great accomplishment.  I can go away feeling great and knowing I haven't left anything for my Supervisor to do.Well I guess I should try and start organising what I'm taking away.  Take care and I will keep posting now that I have some great stuff to post about

author: duchess
title: officially missing...him
post_content: weird...its not even a day after he left...but i knew i'd be missing him...and i think i would...tomorrow maybe...could be today...if i kept on thinking about the good times...if i think of the bad times...maybe never...naaaah, can't say never...damn!how did i managed to lose him...looking back...its been a year...and i've missed him a hundred times before...he might never be back...'we' will never be back...but i would not cry...not until i reach my bed...
